file_content.text: Got something you might want to look into, Commander. A group of pirates called the Crimson Fang have taken over Port Nowhere.
Guess when you were on ice for five years, the station decided you weren't in charge anymore. Might be time to remind them you're still around.
Not sure if you know the place. Port Nowhere's a popular smuggler's hideout--an old Hutt dreadnaught that got converted into a space station.
Still gathering intel on the Crimson Fang leaders, but word is they've got a major weapons haul stashed in the cargo hold. Keep you updated as more info comes in.
Nice work, Commander. The Crimson Fang is nothing but a memory thanks to you, and Port Nowhere is firmly under Alliance control.
You really made the scum on that station pay. Guess they deserved it for turning their backs on you. Remind me to stay on your good side.
Gonna take a while to clean out all the bodies you left behind. Remind me to stay on your good side.
Sends a message to my underworld contacts, though. Makes 'em think twice before double crossing the Alliance.
Nice work, Commander. The Crimson Fang has collapsed, and Port Nowhere has thrown in with the Alliance.
Must feel good knowing you're the only person in galactic history to take over that station twice.
You must have made an impression. The scum on that station normally won't side with anyone.
And with Port Nowhere in our corner, my underworld pals will cut us a deal on future trades. I call that a win.
Commander, just got a message from an old friend... a Twi'lek gunslinger named "Whisper." He's on Port Nowhere, and he isn't happy about the Crimson Fang taking over.
Whisper doesn't say much. The Hutts cut his tongue out when he was a kid. Now he lets his blaster do the talking.
You're coming up on his location now. He's in a bit of a jam, but if you help him survive the fight, he'll help you take down the Crimson Fang leader.
You and Whisper will make a good team, Commander. Don't expect him to stick around after the battle, though. He likes to work alone.
Never thought I'd see Whisper lose a fight, but at least he went down blasters blazing. Shame. Would've been nice to have him on our side.
